intro: Cestichis angustilabris, commonly known as the narrow-leafed cestichis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
